explanation: send_upgrade_required calls MHD_add_response_header — to determine whether any memcmp-based comparisons of NUL-terminated strings occur you must inspect MHD_add_response_header's implementation. Static call graph shows MHD_add_response_header calls MHD_str_equal_caseless_, so include that symbol (it is the most likely place to use memcmp for case-insensitive string compares). Also include the helper functions called by the header-add path (add_response_header_connection, add_response_entry, MHD_get_response_element_n_) because they may perform further string comparisons or invoke memcmp on header/name/value buffers. Include the standard library function memcmp itself to verify how it is used (length arguments, operands) and whether it is ever applied to NUL-terminated strings (the direct MISRA concern). Finally include the string/constants used as arguments in send_upgrade_required (UPGRADE_REQUIRED_PAGE, WS_SEC_WEBSOCKET_VERSION, and the header-name constant MHD_HTTP_HEADER_SEC_WEBSOCKET_VERSION) so the analyzer can confirm whether the buffers passed to any memcmp calls are null-terminated C strings (and thus whether any memcmp usage would violate the MISRA rule).
